result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:47 PM Defendant Walter W. Short appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. DE does not qualify for PD and plans to complete PFAC. DA Hatch would like to set a STC 30 days out. DA Hatch has no objection to a zoom request. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:50 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:21 PM Walter W. Short appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appeared in court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. DE does not qualify for PD - PFAC. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $10,000.00 signature bond w/conditions no firearms & not to possess, no objection. Waive time limits. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:28 pm.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
